channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Uzo Aduba on her new role, parenthood and working with Shonda Rhimes
item.description: Uzo Aduba stars in the new Netflix murder-mystery series, "The Residence." The Emmy winner spoke with "CBS Mornings" about her love for her character ...

item.title: US envoy in Qatar to join talks on extending fragile Gaza ceasefire
item.description: Negotiators from Israel and Hamas are meeting mediators for the first time since the truce began in January.

item.title: What we know about Duterte's ICC arrest warrant... in 90 seconds
item.description: The BBC's Anna Holligan reports from The Hague, where former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has arrived.

item.title: What is known about the deadly January air crash between a passenger jet and US Army helicopter
How could Putin respond to US-Ukraine ceasefire plan?
item.description: The Kremlin is weighing its options following the US-Ukraine proposal for a 30-day ceasefire.

item.title: Is the U.S. heading for a recession? Here's what economists say.
item.description: Consumers, businesses and investors are increasingly jittery about the risks of a protracted slump. So what exactly is a recession?

item.title: EPA eliminating environmental justice jobs
item.description: The positions will be eliminated "immediately," according to a memo by Environmental Protection Agency Administrator Lee Zeldin.

item.title: Mediators seek a new deal to release more than half of the hostages in Gaza
item.description: President Trump's Mideast envoy Steve Witkoff is taking part in ceasefire talks in Qatar, the most serious Israel-Hamas talks since Trump took office.

item.title: Universities across the U.S. freeze hiring as federal funding hangs in the balance
item.description: With uncertainties around federal funding for higher education, some schools are cutting back. Experts say that could hurt not only students and facul...

item.title: Mahmoud Khalil didn’t wear a mask. He’s now the face of Trump’s crackdown on campus protests
Credit counseling vs. bankruptcy vs. debt relief: Which path is right for you?
item.description: If you're trying to tackle your debt problems, it's important to know what strategy makes the most sense.

item.title: NTSB urges ban on some helicopter flights at Washington airport where 67 people died in midair crash
item.description: Federal investigators looking for the cause of the January collision between a passenger jet and an Army helicopter near Washington, D.C., that killed...

item.title: Pakistan army says 300 hostages freed from train
item.description: More than 30 militants were killed in the operation, a military spokesperson says.

item.title: Congress reignites a bipartisan effort to ban hair discrimination
item.description: Previous attempts to pass the legislation banning hair discrimination have stalled in Congress.

item.title: What Trump's cuts to the Department of Education mean for schools and students
item.description: The DoE is cutting staff, halting grants and pressuring schools on various administration priorities. Washington Post writer Laura Meckler discusses i...

item.title: Inflation eased in February, but it's still too high for comfort
item.description: Consumer prices in February were up 2.8% from a year ago. That's a smaller annual increase than the previous month. But the president's trade war coul...

item.title: Philippines' Duterte in The Hague after ICC arrest over drug war
item.description: Duterte, who led a "drug war" that killed thousands, was arrested for alleged crimes against humanity.

item.title: How to qualify for a credit card hardship program this spring
item.description: If you need extra help with your credit card debt, there are a few ways to qualify for a hardship program now.
